720759f.folder: Lafayette Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

732588f-b.title: Police activities - Traffic officer.
732588f-b.text:
Police Activities: A set of 4 views showing the traffic officer stationed at Lafayette and Grand Streets during the performance of his duties. The photographer is viewing westward on Grand Street and shows the aforementioned individual being congratulated by (what the writer believes to be) a civic official of the 1st District Municipal Count (which appears on the right of only one of these views). Another possibility is that this person may be connected with the Police Department as the Central Headquarters is in the vicinity. Note that at this date traffic is equally divided between horse drawn and Mechanical forms of propulsion.

About 1925.
Views 1,2,3 and 4

View #1 - 1961
View #2 - 1962
View #3 - 1963
View #4 - 1964
732588f-b.folder: Lafayette Street and Grand Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

720078f-a.text:
(1)
146 Grand Street (left) at the N.W. corner of Lafayette Street, showing the 1st District Municipal Court. Also shown oi;ht) are Nos. 174 and 176 Lafayette Street, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Grand
Street.
March 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A photo taken during the renovation period of this structure.
Note the classic adherence to former lines.
June 8, 1937.
W.P.A. photo
5 Boroughs Project

720079f-a.text:
146 Grand Street (left) at the N.W. corner of Lafayette (Elm) Street. Shown on the right are Nos. 174 and 176 Lafayette Street, adjoining and
north of the corner.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.
720079f-a.folder: Grand Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY

720758f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including Grand Street, shoving construction work in progress on the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway. Lafayette Street was created by the joining of Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Sersey Street with Lafayette Place, which comnenced at Great Jones Street. Its Dresent name was given the completed thoroughfare several years later.
May 6, 1901.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.
720758f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720760f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including Grand Street, showing construction work in progress on the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway. Lafayette Street was created by the joining of Elm Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street with Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. Its present name was given the completed thoroughfare several years later.
April 1, 1901.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.
720760f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY
